pullRequest.body:
Proves some helpful properties of `Monoid.exponent` on `Submonoid G` and `Subgroup G`:
- the exponent of a group is equal to 1 iff the monoid is trivial (previously only the reverse implication was proven)
- the exponent of `G` divides the exponent of `H` if there exists a multiplication-preserving injection from `G` to `H`
- `Monoid.exponent G = Monoid.exponent H` if `G â‰ƒ* H`
- `Monoid.exponent âŠ¤ = Monoid.exponent G`
- `g ^ Monoid.exponent H = 1` if `g âˆˆ H`
- generalizes `one_lt_exponent` to `LeftCancelMonoid`

---

This PR belongs to my series of PRs around the formalization of [Rubin's theorem](https://arxiv.org/abs/2203.05930), although these lemmas are only really needed for one step of the proof.

A small tweak will be necessary once #9975 merges.

```suggestion
  rw [Nat.one_lt_iff_ne_zero_and_ne_one]
  exact âŸ¨exponent_ne_zero_of_finite, mt exp_eq_one_iff.mp (not_subsingleton G)âŸ©
```

This seems like an odd way to phrase it; why not:
```suggestion
theorem exponent_eq_of_mulEquiv (e : G â‰ƒ* H) : Monoid.exponent G = Monoid.exponent H :=
```
You're right, I must have forgotten that equality is a `Prop`, so no data from `e` can be extracted from the theorem's result anyway
